Kinchaku (purse) with netsuke and ojime on chord

label: Description
value: Rectangular purse of Cuir de Cordoue — Dutch leather tooled in a floral design, gilded and painted. Edges and seals bound with leather. Flap closing with a metal fastener of cooper alloy and brass, incised and inlaid flower design. Black silk chord. Kagami-buta netsuke, base ivory, plaque silver alloy with gold and copper relief inlay.

label: Physical description
value: Tooled leather (purse); incised and inlaid copper alloy and brass (clasp); carved ivory and shibuichi (netsuke); silk (chord)

value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description

Flap closing with ornament over clasp of Fujiyama, in colored enamels on copper. Netsuke of ivory openwork, showing design of peony flowers and foliage. Ojime, flowers of various colors on a green field. Cord of blue silk.
